intro: Chrysochosma greggii, commonly known as Gregg's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
